sub_topic: Identifying the clique number of a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

```
     A -- B
     |    |
     C -- D -- E
```

Calculate the clique number of the graph.
message_2: The clique number of a graph is the size of the largest complete subgraph (clique) in the graph. In this case, the largest complete subgraphs are {A, B, C} and {B, C, D}, both of which have 3 vertices. Therefore, the clique number of the graph is 3.
